business.headline: Sensex falls 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 10 lakh crore on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked by 1,1018.20 points to end at 76,293.60, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 309.80 points to close at 23,071.80.

India's inflation likely to dip to a 5-month low of 4.60% in January: ReportThe country's consumer inflation is expected to fall to a five-month low of 4.60% in January 2025, as compared to 5.22% which was recorded in December last year, as per Reuters.

India to keep ban on Chinese investments for now, says Chief Economic AdviserSpeaking at an event in Mumbai on Tuesday, Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) V. Anantha Nageswaran said that any changes to the current restrictions would take time and require a deeper understanding between both countries.

Coimbatore company rewards employees with Rs 14.5 crore bonus. Here's whyA few days ago, the CEO, Saravana Kumar, formally announced the release of the bonus. He shared that he deliberately did not choose to offer employee stock options (ESOPS) or performance-based incentives.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia critisises Aadhaar and UPI in a podcast Sabeer Bhatia mentioned that the use of video and voiceprint technology for the Aadhaar project, which is already embedded in smartphones, could have been a better approach which could have achieved the same results at much lower costs.

Not Mumbai or Bengaluru, this Indian city leads in luxury home price surgeMumbai, traditionally known for its expensive real estate, was placed seventh in the global rankings for luxury home price surge.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's stock market bloodbath?Stock market crash: At 1:12 pm, the Sensex was down 1051.88 points to 76,261.90, and the Nifty fell 321.15 points to 23,060.45. Most broader market indices were also in the red as volatility spiked sharply.

New Income Tax Bill expected soon: Here's what taxpayers can expect The new bill aims to make direct tax laws simpler, reduce litigation, and remove ambiguities in the current system. Experts believe it will be easier to understand, more user-friendly, and free of unnecessary complexities.

Sacked Infosys trainees share ordeal after mass termination: 'This is inhumane'The sacked trainee employees, who were onboarded after 2.5 years of wait, were called in batches of 50 starting from 9.30 am on February 7. They were escorted to a room guarded by security and bouncers where they were made to sign a mutual separation letter.

PM Modi inaugurates India Energy Week 2025, outlines green energy targetsPrime Minister Narendra Modi virtually launched India Energy Week 2025, reaffirming India's commitment to green energy. He announced plans to add 500 GW of renewable capacity and outlined ambitious 2030 sustainability goals, citing India's strong track record over the past decade.

Explained: Why Zomato share price plunged over 5% todayZomato stock price: Shares of the company have been under pressure ever since global brokerage firm Jefferies raised concerns over rising competition in the quick commerce space.

India 1st G20 country to achieve Paris Agreement goals, says PM Narendra ModiPrime Minister Narendra Modi also outlined various other green energy targets to achieve by the year 2030, calling them ambitious yet possible given the excellent track record in the past 10 years.

Why Eicher Motors shares dropped 7% despite record Royal Enfield sales in Q3Eicher Motors stock price fell nearly 7% in early trade despite reporting a 18% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit.

Nokia picks Intel's AI and data centre leader Justin Hotard as new CEOJustin Hotard, who will take up the position on April 1, is currently the executive vice president and general manager of Data Center & AI Group at Intel, according to the chipmaker's website.
Stock market sell-off hurting your portfolio? Here's what you can doThe ongoing stock market sell-off has hit retail investors hard, dragging portfolios deep into the red.

Sensex falls nearly 200 points, Nifty struggles in early tradeStock Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 197.45 points to 77,114.35 at 9:29 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 62.90 points to trade at 23,318.70. All the other broader market indices were also trading in negative territory.

Own more than 1 property? Why you don't need to worry about additional taxThe reform announced in Budget 2025 regarding two self-occupied properties would encourage investment across the country's real-estate segment and would also enhance affordability for homebuyers.
Bears rampage Dalal Street as Sensex, Nifty close lower on US tariff fearsThe BSE Sensex dropped 548.79 points to close at 77,311.80, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 178.35 points to end at 23,381.60.

Explained: Why you shouldn't stop investing despite opting for new tax regime Tax-savings incentives like the Public Provident Fund (PPF), National Savings Certificate (NSC) and Equity-Linked Savings Scheme (ELSS) not only helped individuals lower their taxes but also induced disciplined savings habits, particularly among young people in developing financial prudence early in their careers.
Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta on SIPs: 'Don't fall for fear-mongering'Radhika Gupta reiterated that patience and a long-term approach are essential for SIP investors.

entertainment.headline: Munawar Faruqui to Vir Das, comedians who landed in trouble for inappropriate jokesAs podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia faces backlash for his obscene jokes on an episode of India's Got Latent, here's a look at other stand-up comedians who have found themselves in trouble.

Diddy allegedly 'drugged and raped' a man, claims new lawsuitMusic mogul Sean Combs is embroiled in fresh legal trouble as an anonymous plaintiff files a sexual assault lawsuit against him in New York.

The phone dropped...: Story of Jitendra Kumar's humility and unassuming successActor Jitendra Kumar, popularly known as Jeetu Bhaiya, says the bigger thing is not to decide whether to take a risk in life or not, but to know what is at stake.

Arunachal women panel condemns Elvish Yadav's 'racist' remarks against Chum DarangThe Arunachal Pradesh State Commission for Women has condemned Elvish Yadav's derogatory remarks against Chum Darang and has demanded strict action. The comments have sparked backlash.

Kadhalikka Neramillai: Nithya Menen, Ravi Mohan's rom-com now streaming on NetflixKadhalikka Neramillai, the heartfelt romantic film, starring Nithya Menen and Ravi Mohan is streaming on OTT. The Tamil film had its theatrical release on January 14.

Suzhal The Vortex Season 2 to premiere on Prime Video this monthA brand-new season of the Tamil Prime Video series, Suzhal: The Vortex, was announced on Tuesday. The show will begin streaming on the OTT platform from this month itself.

Squid Game 3 to have 6 episodes. Fans say 'they better be 2 hours long'Fans of Squid Game are eagerly awaiting the third season. However, the revelation of the season having only six episodes has left many fans disappointed.

Solo Leveling Season 2: Animation peaks as Jinwoo defeats dungeon bossThe latest episode of Solo Leveling peaked with its brilliantly animated fight sequence. In the episode, titled Don't Look Down on My Guys, Sung Jinwoo clashed with Karlgargan.

Uorfi Javed defends friend Samay Raina amid calls for his arrestUorfi Javed slammed people demanding jail time for YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia and comedian Samay Raina after Allahbadia's obscene joke on India's Got Latent went viral.

Samay Raina in Seattle as India's Got Latent and Ranveer Allahbadia face backlashIndian stand-up comedian Samay Raina recently performed in Seattle, as controversies surrounding Ranveer Allahbadia and India's Got Latent stirred social media discussions in India.

Rakhi Sawant asks forgiveness for Ranveer AllahbadiaActor Rakhi Sawant shared a message for fans amid the Ranveer Allahbadia controversy. She requested all to 'forgive' the YouTuber for his recent crass jokes on Samay Raina's show.

Why Sanya Malhotra's Mrs should come with a trigger warningMrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, explores patriarchal society and the struggles of women in arranged marriages. Here's why this movie should come with a trigger warning and must be on your watchlist.

Singer Charlie Puth to Kanye West for selling Swastika T-shirts: I beg you to stopSinger Charlie Puth 'begged' Kanye West to stop after he sold Swastika T-shirts on his website. Kanye's move sparked concern about his 'incredibly dangerous' claims.

Ankita Lokhande tears down Rozlyn Khan's claims about Hina Khan's cancer: So cheapAnkita Lokhande slammed Rozlyn Khan for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle. She called out Rozlyn Khan's claims 'cheap'.

Bryan Adams's Australia concert cancelled due to overflowing sewageSinger Bryan Adams's Australia concert was cancelled due to an overflowing sewage issue caused by a "large blockage" of fat, grease, and rags. Adams apologised to fans and assured them that tickets would be refunded.

Arijit Singh takes Ed Sheeran on scooter ride in his hometown in West Bengal. WatchSinger Arijit Singh took pop singer Ed Sheeran on a scooter ride in West Bengal's Jiaganj. The English singer-songwriter ditched heavy security and enjoyed his ride through the streets of West Bengal.

Comedian Kapil Sharma meets Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan YadavKapil Sharma met Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav in Bhopal and shared glimpses of their meeting on social media. He also expressed his gratitude.

BB 18's Chum Darang shares cryptic post after Elvish Yadav's racist remarksChum Darang shared a cryptic post on Instagram, advocating for respect and equality. This came after Elvish Yadav made racist remarks about her.

Decoding Grammy winner Kendrick Lamar's Superbowl half-time performanceKendrick Lamar became the first rapper to headline the Super Bowl solo, marking a major milestone in his career. The performance, featuring SZA and a memorable moment with Serena Williams, somewhat sparked debate on social media.

Jeetendra Kumar aka Jeetu Bhaiya on love, Panchayat, Gen-Z, Kota Factory and IITActor Jeetendra Kumar, popularly known by his screen name, Jeetu Bhaiya from Kota Factory, spoke in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, about the time when he, for the first time, tasted success. He also discussed his famous roles - Sachiv ji and Jeetu Bhaiya, and mentioned his idea of love and whether he agrees with the Gen-Z and 'situation-ships'.

general news.headline: AI writing code for humanity, global efforts needed to mitigate risks: PM Modi Live UpdatesPrime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing the AI Summit in Paris, highlighted AI's transformative potential in reshaping society, economy, and security, while calling for collective global efforts to establish transparent and inclusive technological governance.

Count yours in Delhi: Bhagwant Mann jabs Congress on 'Punjab MLAs exodus' claimBhagwant Mann's remarks came after attending a meeting called by Arvind Kejriwal just days after his Aam Aadmi Party faced a crushing defeat in the Delhi Assembly elections, with the BJP securing a thumping victory by winning 48 seats.

Ranveer Allahbadia vulgar joke row may echo in Parliament, panel summons likelyRanveer Allahbadia Controversy: The development comes following complaints from several MPs and FIRs against Ranveer Allahbadia and comedian Samay Raina over the controversial episode on India's Got Latent, a popular YouTube show.

Appreciate his point: JD Vance lauds PM's remark on fears of AI replacing humansLauding PM Modi's speech at the Paris AI Action Summit, US Vice President JD Vance underscored that AI would never replace human beings.

Why farmers have choked central London with tanks, tractorsHundreds of farmers along with their tractors flocked to Central London to protest against the proposed 20% tax on farm inheritances. Not just tractors, a tank was also seen rolling in London's Parliament Street. The protest in London involving tractors comes months after similar protests were seen in half-a-dozen countries in Europe.

Sensex crashes over 1,000 points: What's behind today's stock market bloodbath?Stock market crash: At 1:12 pm, the Sensex was down 1051.88 points to 76,261.90, and the Nifty fell 321.15 points to 23,060.45. Most broader market indices were also in the red as volatility spiked sharply.

Who will be next Manipur Chief Minister? 5 frontrunners for Biren Singh's postBiren Singh resigned as Manipur Chief Minister two years after violence hit the northeastern state. While the BJP is yet to name his successor, five faces are in focus.

Donald Trump pauses foreign bribery law. Reason for Gautam Adani to smile?The potential impact of Trump's suspension of Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) enforcement is significant, particularly for companies like the Adani Group.

How and where Indian Metro is adding 1,000km to become world No. 2While viral fights and dance videos on our Metro trains steal the spotlight, India's metro is silently rewriting the record books. India has 1,000 km of metro network across 17 cities, and is adding another 1,000 km to it. This is where and how the country is adding metro lines to overtake the US as the world's second-biggest Metro network.

Indian-origin woman takes a flight to work daily in Malaysia, says it's cost-efficientAn Indian-origin woman, living in Malaysia, has revealed that she takes a flight to work 5 days a week, travels over 700 kilometres a day, and it is still cost-efficient for her. Read on to know more.

Need to skill, re-skill people for AI-driven future: PM Modi's top quotesPrime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the AI Action Summit in Paris in the presence of French President Emmanuel Macron and US Vice President JD Vance.

Scientists decode mechanism behind how the brain makes a decisionScientists have cracked the code of the decision-making process in the human brain. The prefrontal cortex is the key to decision-making.

Why Ranveer Allahbadia, Samay Raina have got everybody enragedRanveer Allahbadia Controversy: Multiple cases have been filed against YouTubers Ranveer Allahbadia and Samay Raina over an obscene joke in an episode of India's Got Latent. But what got everybody so enraged? Here's an overview.

iPhone SE 4 may launch today: India price, big design overhaul and moreApple's new affordable iPhone is expected to launch on Tuesday, February 11. Although, Apple has yet to confirm the date of launch.

The hole new world of Rahul Gandhi's CongressThe BJP won the Delhi elections, the AAP lost, and the Congress didn't even start. Yet, the Congress is jubilant that Prime Minister Narendra Modi did not beat the AAP, the AAP beat itself up.

The phone dropped...: Story of Jitendra Kumar's humility and unassuming successActor Jitendra Kumar, popularly known as Jeetu Bhaiya, says the bigger thing is not to decide whether to take a risk in life or not, but to know what is at stake.

Why Sanya Malhotra's Mrs should come with a trigger warningMrs, starring Sanya Malhotra, explores patriarchal society and the struggles of women in arranged marriages. Here's why this movie should come with a trigger warning and must be on your watchlist.

Delhi woman holds toddler on rooftop edge, records video from one hand, slammedA woman shared a video of herself holding her toddler near the edge of a rooftop while recording the clip from her other hand. The video has angered the internet.

Elon Musk offers $97 billion to buy OpenAI, Sam Altman rejectsElon Musk with a few more investors proposed a buyout offer of $97 billion to OpenAI CEO Sam Altman. But, Altman rejected the proposal, saying "no thank you".

Delhi Elections: A masterclass in strategy by Team ModiIn Haryana, Maharashtra, and now in Delhi, Narendra Modi personally ensured that the miffed karyakarta came back to trudge the streets, knock on the doors, man the booths, and unobtrusively spread the message while keeping the faith.

Meet 5 Maruti cars with 6 airbags as standard. No Fronx, Baleno, Ertiga hereAlthough Maruti is working to make six airbags a standard fitment in more cars, the addition of extra airbags will result in a price hike.

Sacked Infosys trainees share ordeal after mass termination: 'This is inhumane'The sacked trainee employees, who were onboarded after 2.5 years of wait, were called in batches of 50 starting from 9.30 am on February 7. They were escorted to a room guarded by security and bouncers where they were made to sign a mutual separation letter.

Trump fires the penny. Why India's one-rupee sikka is here to stayUS President Donald Trump has ordered a halt to the minting of pennies, the coins denoting a cent of the dollar, over high production costs. The minting cost of India's Re 1 coin is also more than its face value. However, the 'ek rupiya ka sikka' holds ground and has high relevance in everyday transactions and traditions.

AAP's Amanatullah Khan on the run amid arrest bid for aiding criminal's escapeA case has been filed against AAP's Okhla MLA Amanatullah Khan for interrupting a police operation in Jamia, leading to the escape of a wanted criminal.

Vicky Kaushal on pre-release tradition: Mother visits SiddhivinayakActor Vicky Kaushal, in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, spoke about following a religious ritual before the release of his film. He said his mother always visits the famous Siddhivinayak temple in Mumbai on the day of the release. Read on.

Vicky Kaushal praises Rashmika Mandanna's professionalism: Never seen her crankyActors Vicky Kaushal and Rashmika Mandanna will soon be seen sharing screen space in the period drama, Chhava. The film releases in cinemas on February 14.

Jr NTR lends voice for Telugu teaser of Vijay Deverakonda's VD 12. PicsThe much-anticipated Vijay Deverakonda-starrer, tentatively titled VD 12, is making waves ahead of its teaser release. Producer Naga Vamsi has officially confirmed that Jr NTR has lent his voice for the film's title teaser, which is set to be unveiled on February 12.

Viral: Javed Akhtar's poetic reply on use of abuse in comedy amid Samay Raina rowVeteran lyricist Javed Akhtar's earlier remarks about the use of abuse in comedy is being widely circulated on social media once again after YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's comments on Samay Raina's show, India's Got Talent.

sports.headline: Former India bowler names Bumrah's perfect replacement for Champions TrophyWith questions surrounding Jasprit Bumrah's fitness, former India bowler Atul Wassan has named his ideal replacement for the ace speedster in the Champions Trophy 2025 squad.

Best seat in the house: Lanning on enjoying batting with Shafali in WPLWPL 2025: Delhi Capitals' skipper Meg Lanning said that she has enjoyed batting alongside Shafali Verma. Both Lanning and Shafali are expected to play key roles when DC start their campaign on February 15 against Mumbai Indians.

Special to be back with KKR, didn't want to play for another team: Vaibhav AroraVaiubhav Arora expressed his delight at being picked up by KKR during the IPL 2025 auction and claimed that he didn't want to play for another team. Vaibhav played a big role in KKR's title win in 2024.

IPL 2025: Ahmedabad-based conglomerate to buy majority stake in Gujarat TitansTorrent Group, an Ahmedabad-based conglomerate, will purchase a 67 per cent stake in Gujarat Titans. The deal is awaiting final approval from the IPL governing council.

Warrican beats Varun Chakravathy to win ICC Player of the Month for JanuaryWest Indies spinner Jomel Warrican has beaten Varun Chakravarthy to clinch the ICC Player of the Month Award for January. Warrican had a sensational Test series against Pakistan where he picked up 19 wickets from 2 Test matches.

Pakistan to unveil renovated Karachi stadium, honour construction workersPakistan will unveil the renovated National Stadium in Karachi on the eve of the tri-series match between Pakistan and South Africa. The venue will host three matches, including the opener, in Champions Trophy 2025.

Without Bumrah, India have the weakest pace attack in Champions Trophy: ChopraJasprit Bumrah's availability for the Champions Trophy is under clouds. Former cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that without Bumrah, India perhaps have the weakest fast bowling attack in their group in the upcoming ICC tournament.

India might not need Yashasvi Jaiswal in Champions Trophy, says Aakash Chopra Champions Trophy 2025: With India expected to make a few changes to their final 15-man squad, Aakash Chopra said that Yashasvi Jaiswal might miss out due to the settled batting line-up.

Ed Sheeran enjoys batting session with Rajasthan Royals, dons Warne 23 jerseyIPL 2025: Ed Sheeran decided to enjoy a bit of cricket alongside Rajasthan Royals stars Riyan Parag and Tushar Deshpande. Sheeran was also given a special jersey that had the name of his close friend and legendary spinner Shane Warne.

Fit-again Djokovic ready for Qatar Open comeback in February, eyes 100th title24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic, chasing his 100th title on the tour, confirmed he will return to action in Qatar Open, starting February 17. The Serb withdrew midway during his Australian Open semi-final due to an injury.

Watch: Ellyse Perry shakes off injury doubts, reaches RCB base in 'Stone Cold' styleWPL 2025: Ellyse Perry has shaken off injury doubts and has arrived at the Royal Challengers Bengaluru base ahead of the start of the Women's Premier League 2025 season. Perry played a vital role in RCB's title win last season.

Without Bumrah, India have the weakest pace attack in Champions Trophy: ChopraJasprit Bumrah's availability for the Champions Trophy is under clouds. Former cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that without Bumrah, India perhaps have the weakest fast bowling attack in their group in the upcoming ICC tournament.

Sheeran was also given a special jersey that had the name of his close friend and legendary spinner Shane Warne.

The Serb withdrew midway during his Australian Open semi-final due to an injury.

Watch: Ellyse Perry shakes off injury doubts, reaches RCB base in 'Stone Cold' styleWPL 2025: Ellyse Perry has shaken off injury doubts and has arrived at the Royal Challengers Bengaluru base ahead of the start of the Women's Premier League 2025 season. Perry played a vital role in RCB's title win last season.

Ranji Trophy quarters: Rahane hits hundred to celebrate special 200 in style Ranji Trophy 2024-25: Ajinkya Rahane celebrated his 200th first-class appearance by hitting a match-defining hundred against Haryana in the quarter-final at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

IND vs ENG: India, England reach Ahmedabad ahead of 3rd and final ODIIndia and England reached Ahmedabad ahead of the 3rd and final ODI of the series on Monday, January 10. Both teams will be aiming for the win as they look to step up their preparations for the Champions Trophy 2025. India already won the series with their victory during the Cuttack ODI.

Saim Ayub-less Pakistan face stiff challenge to end barren run   Champions Trophy 2025 Preview: Pakistan have done well recently under Mohammad Rizwan's captaincy, but having not won an ICC title since 2017, they will be under pressure to put up a good show in front of their home crowd.

Constant spotlight on Virat Kohli is quite unnecessary: Arjuna RanatungaFormer Sri Lankan captain Arjuna Ranatunga feels that the constant spotlight on Virat Kohli is unnecessary as the Indian star struggles to find form with the bat. Kohli scored just 5 runs in the Cuttack ODI.

SL vs AUS ODIs: Vandersay in, Wickramasinghe out as Sri Lanka name strong squad Sri Lanka have brought back Jeffrey Vandersay and decided to leave out Chamindu Wickramasinghe as they named a strong squad for the upcoming ODI series against Australia, starting on February 12.

Varun in, Bumrah out? Will India make changes in final Champions Trophy squad?The deadline day for finalising squad for the Champions Trophy is here. With the ICC set to lock-in squads on February 11, Tuesday, will India make changes to its preliminary side?

Champions Trophy: NCA team works hard with Jasprit Bumrah to get pacer fit The NCA team in Bengaluru is working hard with Jasprit Bumrah to get the fast bowler fit before the Champions Trophy. Bumrah hasn't played any form of cricket since the New Year's Test against Australia.

Mumbai Indians acquire 49 per cent stake in Oval Invincibles Mumbai Indians, through its subsidiary, RISE, claimed a 49 per cent stake in The Oval Invincibles, the most successful team in the history of the Hundred. The MI franchise recently tasted success after MI Cape Town won the SA20 2025.

SL vs AUS ODIs: Vandersay in, Wickramasinghe out as Sri Lanka name strong squad Sri Lanka have brought back Jeffrey Vandersay and decided to leave out Chamindu Wickramasinghe as they named a strong squad for the upcoming ODI series against Australia, starting on February 12.

Varun in, Bumrah out? Will India make changes in final Champions Trophy squad?The deadline day for finalising squad for the Champions Trophy is here. With the ICC set to lock-in squads on February 11, Tuesday, will India make changes to its preliminary side?

Champions Trophy: NCA team works hard with Jasprit Bumrah to get pacer fit The NCA team in Bengaluru is working hard with Jasprit Bumrah to get the fast bowler fit before the Champions Trophy. Bumrah hasn't played any form of cricket since the New Year's Test against Australia.

Mumbai Indians acquire 49 per cent stake in Oval Invincibles Mumbai Indians, through its subsidiary, RISE, claimed a 49 per cent stake in The Oval Invincibles, the most successful team in the history of the Hundred. The MI franchise recently tasted success after MI Cape Town won the SA20 2025.

Serena Williams dances to Kendrick Lamar's tunes at Super Bowl, Djokovic reacts 24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic praised the legendary Serena Williams for her dance moves during the Halftime show at the Super Bowl when rapper Kendrick Lamar performed the song 'Not Like Us'.

Shardul eyes Test return in England, open to playing County after IPL snubAll-rounder Shardul Thakur is eyeing India comeback in the tour of England, set to be held in the months of June and July. Shardul has been in sensational form in the Ranji Trophy with both bat and ball in the last 2 seasons.

Ranji Trophy: Shardul knocks on selectors' doors, Suryakumar and Rahane shineRanji Trophy quarterfinal: Mumbai rode on Shardul Thakur's heroic six-wicket haul to secure a crucial first innings lead against Haryana in Kolkata. Captain Ajinkya Rahane and Suryakumar Yadav shone with the bat in the second innings to stretch the defending champions' lead.

Gambhir, you're not being fair to KL Rahul: Ex-captain upset over ODI experimentsIndia vs England: KL Rahul gave up his favourite batting spot to accommodate Axar Patel, who was promoted by the team management to bat at No. 5 in the first two ODIs. While Axar made good use of the opportunities, Rahul failed with the bat in Nagpur and Cuttack.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
